{"step_by_step_thinking": "The mesiodistal diameter refers to the measurement of a tooth from its mesial (front) surface to its distal (back) surface. The smallest mesiodistal diameter is typically seen in the smallest tooth. Among the options given, the deciduous teeth, also known as baby teeth, are generally smaller than the permanent teeth. Among the deciduous teeth, the lower central incisor is typically the smallest.", "answer_choice": "A. Deciduous lower central incisor"}
